events.event_description: U.S. ethane production increased 9% to reach a record 2.6 million barrels per day, driven by record natural gas production.
events.citation: U.S. ethane production rose 9% to average 2.6 million barrels per day (b/d) in 2023, driven by record natural gas production.

events.event_description: Two new petrochemical crackers in Port Arthur, Texas, and Monaca, Pennsylvania began ramping up operations after their initial launch.
events.citation: Two new petrochemical crackers, located in Port Arthur, Texas, and in Monaca, Pennsylvania, ramped up operations in 2023 after coming on line in late 2022.

events.event_description: U.S. ethane exports reached a record 471,000 barrels per day, with China being the largest importer at 45% of total exports.
events.citation: U.S. ethane exports averaged a record 471,000 b/d during 2023, a 57,000-barrel increase from the previous record set the year before. China imported 45% of U.S. ethane exports in 2023, followed by India (16%), Canada (14%), and Norway (10%).

events.event_description: Ethane prices at Mont Belvieu, Texas peaked at 39 cents per gallon in mid-July before falling to below 18 cents per gallon by year-end.
events.citation: Ethane prices averaged under 25 cents per gallon (gal) for the year but briefly rose close to 39 cents/gal ($5.89 per million British thermal units) in mid-July. Ethane prices fell below 18 cents/gal in the last week of the year due to lower natural gas prices.
